intro: Apeiba aspera, commonly known as the rough apeiba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
